reviews.title: Excellent view for Grand Prix fireworks

reviews.title: Excellent architecture
Satisfactory - pricey breakfast
reviews.text: As I am also a platinum member of the hotel group, we received an upgrade to a suite on the 19th floor. (I finally managed to get an upgrade which is very rare in other hotels in this group)
We loved the the archtecture of this hotel with the 25 storey internal atrium - it feels like a five star hotel, but then it is a Holiday Inn!
reviews.title: perfect hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite was great with a proper kingsize bed, separate lounge area, toilet and wetroom with shower and bath. We had great views of half of Singapore. (You will never see more than half due to the circular nature of the building!)
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our rate, which was excellent - all the usual 'full english' and continental items were available.
reviews.title: Getting better

likes.disliked: — Keep giving out outdated/faulty complementary car park tickets

reviews.text: I came to Sing on vacation, and this place is nothing to write home about. The atrium IS pretty, but the rooms themselves have a good 1970's feel to them. Everything looks old and tired, from the light colors to the doors to the rooms. It's not terrible; just looks worn in.
reviews.title: No real reason to stay here.

reviews.text: Location - a fair walk from the MRT. I would say a minimum of 12 minutes, and I'm in good shape. Not terribly ideal since you will spend a fair amount of time waiting for the MRT. Also, a taxi to this location automatically adds $3 SGD since it is considered "inside city limits," whatever that means. Getting anywhere via the MRT will take you a while if you stay at this hotel...
reviews.title: A 4-start hotel with great value, located in a nice, quiet neighborhood; not too far from major attractions.

reviews.text: Bottom line- if you are on business, fine. Other than that, the location isn't the most efficient for getting around.
reviews.title: Well worth your visit :)

reviews.text: Holiday Inn Atrium, Singapore (Aug 29-Sept 05, 2011)
reviews.title: Getting a bit long in the tooth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Holiday Inn Atrium, located in a very nice, quiet neighborhood deserves a 4-star billing, with its comfortable, spacious rooms, luxury styled comfortable lobby, which has a nice bar and inviting lounge area; great amenities such as complimentary business center,  free wifi in lobby, gym and pool; friendly and helpful staff; convenient bus stops leading to subway stations and local major attractions.
reviews.title: Hotel desperately needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many reviews have complained that location isn't near MRT - we were on our first visit to Singapore so can't comment on how much an inconvenience that is as we didn't use it. I found the area good - right across the road you are on the river with Robertson Quay a few minutes walk, then on to Clarke Quay, say 15 mins, with plenty of restaurants & bars. We were in Singapore for the Formula 1 weekend and we found we could walk (although it took about 30-45mins) to the Marina Bay area so it was ideal. Also World City mall is only about 10mins walk in the other direction with shops and food courts, and there is also a new hawker centre where we got chicken rice for the 2 of us for £5 - you don't get fancy cutlery/crockery or alcohol but the food was very good.
reviews.title: Functional business hotel, good area

reviews.text: As for the hotel, we were upgraded to an Executive Room (withou the benefits of free breakfast, drinks) - standard rooms are a double with single and I had requested King bed. Don't know if it's common practice to get upgrade or because I'm a Priority Club Platinum member, but the room was very nice, comfortable and clean. Great view over the river from 25th floor - only downside I would say is lack of cupboard space. You get 2 free bottles of water a day and fruit, and the hotel also left a complimentary portable charger, which was great. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment, there are a few shops off the lobby where we could get snacks & soft drinks which was useful. No problem getting taxis at the front door, which are pretty inexpensive. I would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: The BEST place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its a 10/10 experience. We had stayed there for 4 nights in their Suite at 26th Floor. Right from CheckIn to Checkout it was a WOW experience for me and for my family. The girl at reception, Yasmin was too courteous to receive us. She also could accommodate an extra bed to our room for my daughter. Kids were excited to receive welcome kit from yasmin. She knows here job well and carries herself well for the cause of customer. The service at 27th floor lounge was exemplary with Tiffany and another girl ( name starts with S.... may be my wife would remember the name since she got along very well with this ever smiling girl) were too customer centric at all times.
reviews.title: good hotel but do not book via airasiaGo.com

reviews.text: Special thanks to the house keeping girl ( Linda or Lindy perhaps) who made the room in order everyday. Infact one day we had left our Gold ring and Emerald rings on the living room table. On returning back to room late evening, we found the table to be neatly arranged without disturbing the rings. Hats off the housekeeping team for having such honest people on board.
reviews.title: Location Disadvantage

reviews.text: The team at restaurant, the team at concierge were also very helpful.
reviews.title: The lesser of the IHG hotels in Singapore

reviews.text: I often stay here when visiting Singapore for work. The location is convenient for me. Also near the river so can wander on the river bank and head towards Clarke Quay. I am not a fan of the buffet style restaurant - I always go into the Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant on level 4. It's on the same level as the buffet area (Melting Pot) - but a better quality, etc. Staff are always helpful and service always good.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, convenient location

reviews.text: My brother and I stayed here on our 24hr stop over in Singapore, staying in a room with a double bed and single bed. The room was comfy and clean, the service great and the buffet breakfast the next day was amazing. The hotel is not for from one of the stops on the sightseeing bus, which made getting around easy for us. When our private transport didn't arrive the next evening to take us to the airport, the hotel staff organised a taxi for us and allowed us to refresh ourselves in the bathrooms located next to the pool before our flight. Would definitely stya here again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for 1 night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We staid there for the GP1 , and it was quite nice, nothing special , however the staff was very friendly and helpful. Room service was Ok. The location is a little away from the quays. There is a convenient store open until late , that is very convenient.
reviews.title: Quite Nice

reviews.text: sort of 60,s style circular building with all the room facing out from the centre.
reviews.title: good choice for the price

reviews.text: check in staff very efficient, rooms nice and comfy, bathroom a bit small.
reviews.title: Okay

reviews.text: Stayed here during the Grand Prix weekend and although it was expensive it was not over the top. Hotel reception area is impressive as the hotel is extremely large. Rooms were comfortable clean and well appointed. The hotel is far out and not next to MRT which is not ideal. You can however get a taxi to the MRTand will cost you approx £5. Staff are very friendly ans nothing was too much bother for them. A good hotel but not ideal location.
reviews.title: Good hotel - not best location

reviews.text: Staying at this hotel was worth while It is about 20 minutes walk away from Clarke Quay and Orchard road, but there is a free shuttle to and from the hotel. Very nice swimming pool and the restaurant and room service prices are on par with similar establisments in Singapore. Rooms were neat and tidy.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice Hotel - The lobby is quite a view in itself. Rooms are spacious enough. Breakfast spread was decent, though I would like to stick to the Continental one compared to the Indian options. Little far off from MRT station,some what compensated by the bus services provided by hotel to Orchard Road.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Atrium

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall happy - more a business hotel
reviews.title: Well-kept and clean hotel a three-minute walk from the river

reviews.text: If you plan to eat breakfast (they offer a very large selection and will cook omelettes to order) at the HI and use the internet, upgrade to the "executive" room because it includes these features with the price, but you will pay extra for them in a "deluxe" room. In addition, you can use the top floor lounge and enjoy the views.
reviews.title: Not too bad

reviews.text: I normally travel for business, but on this occasion I stayed at the Holiday Inn as my daughter who was on school holidays joined me at the end of the business trip.
reviews.title: Great service, slightly out of the way, expensive WIFI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The atrium is stunning, my daughter and I really enjoyed going up and down from level 16. It was fun to look out going up & down.
reviews.title: Old property but spectacular atrium design and great service.

reviews.text: All the staff are really happy, everyone was very welcoming, all the time. This was a real contrast to the last hotel I stayed in last week in Penang.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel at a great price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was good. Having Indian Dahl was an unusual breakfast for me. There was a wide choice of foods. We ate one night in the cafe, the food was good with a wide selection.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are older, but this was not a problem at all. However the toliet flush is quite noisy.
reviews.title: Good hotel, Average Accessibility around Singapore

reviews.text: My wife, myself and our two grown-up children spent 4 nights in the Holiday Inn Atrium.

reviews.title: Excellent Service. Will definitely go back!

reviews.text: We had an east facing room, and it was very nice and spacious. The bathroom tub could be considered a little outdated, but the amazing deal we got to this place offset that.
reviews.title: My second stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was really impressed by the staff at this hotel. I have been to many hotels where some of the staff are very welcoming and courteous, but at this hotel all the staff treat you amazingly well.
reviews.title: disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge was extremely helpful and the hotel also provides a free shuttle service to Orchard St. which is an excellent shopping destination (or a nice place to find a variety of meals if you aren't interested in the breakfast or other meals at the hotel).
reviews.title: Its not as close to the main attractions in Singapore as portrayed.

reviews.text: I tried the breakfast at the hotel and it was very nice. Tip: they give you $10 off breakfast ($20 instead of $30 per person) if you choose to select a breakfast option during check in. So if you intend on having breakfast here and haven't gotten a breakfast package, then get one at check in.
reviews.title: I loved it and will recommend to friends

reviews.text: I have been to Singapore several times and have stayed an numerous hotels, always based on the best price for a 4*. This time I got the Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Bar Music for Everybody

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location isn't as great as the hotels on Orchard (no walking distance to anywhere special), but it is a quick cabdrive to Clarke Quay and there are malls nearby. I didn't mind, as I was there only to work all week.
reviews.title: recommended value

reviews.text: The breakfast at the Melting Pot Cafe can be considered average - there is the full Western and Eastern selection, plenty of fruit, fresh coffee and cappucino (a plus). Lunch Buffet is tedious, because it is the same every day of the week - being there for a seminar a whole week, I had gotten the buffet booked too. After three days I started going to a food court nearby.
reviews.title: four weeks at the atrium

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The health club is very minimal, the pool is fine, clean, simple but in better shape than for example the Hilton on Orchard.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Female staff let it down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are standard 4*, nothing special, bathrooms are a bit old, but clean and functional, minibar stocked with beer and soft drinks - fine for me.
reviews.title: Very Nice

likes.disliked: — A bit aged looking in the rooms, but nothing bad.

reviews.text: Good place to stay if your expectations of this hotel are basic: a comfortable and clean room at reasonable rates, given the relatively high hotel rates in Singapore.
reviews.title: Comfortable with basic facilities & services

reviews.text: Facilities are basic. It has a decent swimming pool that seemed to have been renovated recently. It also offers free internet access on the ground floor. Both of those facilities were quite empty during my stay there which was nice. It also has a laundry room (SG$5 for washing and SG$5 for drying). The dry cleaning rates are expensive though for the hotel of this class.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with a great Atrium

reviews.text: It is not in the most "central" location but it is still fairly convenient. The nearest good place to eat and shop is Great World City shopping mall by about 10 mins on foot. There are also good bus routes if you know where to catch them. If you know how to navigate your way around Singapore then this hotel is quite good.
reviews.title: Not up to usual Holiday Inn standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was being used as a base for a lot of aircrew.
reviews.title: Staying in Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here many times over twenty years as the hotel has changed ownership several times. It has always been quiet and comfortable and a good value by Singapore standards. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well appointed and the beds are excellent. The staff is efficient and helpful. This may not be one of the 'great' hotels but I've never had a complaint about my stay. The Atrium, especially from the upper floors, is awesome.
reviews.title: Should be 3 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some people have commented on the location but its so easy to get a taxi everywhere and when u're on a holiday, its not everyone that wants to be in the thick of things as in orchard road..e.t.c--infact we found the location to be a plus for us,...it was close to EVERYTHING we needed--church, bicycle rentals,,a nice mall...good hawker center...what more do we need in a location?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I specially recommend the old concierge man who welcomes you as you come in..he is a storehouse of knowledge about Singapore..
reviews.title: Loved Holiday Inn

reviews.text: Some issues with check in when wrong room was given to what we confirmed but this was quickly corrected. Rooms are feeling their age and a little musty.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: Restaurant is below par compared to other Singapore hotels and location is not ideal, nearest train station is 15min walk although there is bus across the road. The surrounds are fairly quiet and although there are no restaurants close by it is only a $5 taxi fare to the restaurants and city. As it was reasonable price cant complain too loudly.
reviews.title: comfortable and great hotel but poor location

description: Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium is one of the leading hotel along the Singapore River. With 508 well-appointed guest rooms and friendly service, stay relaxed with accommodation that will meet your needs. Centrally located, it is in the heart of all Singapore’s attractions and shopping including Great World City which is a mere 5 minutes’ walk away. Nestled along Havelock and Outram Road, you are just steps away from waterfront dining and entertainment from the lines of Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay and Boat Quay. Located at the gateway of the Central Business District (CBD) and financial hub, getting to meetings and company events are quick and hassle-free. Take time to experience and explore Singapore’s culture diversity as Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium is situated close to the bustling notes of Chinatown, Tiong Bahru and the various ethnic areas. Tantalise your taste buds with an array of dining options available within the hotel. Melting Pot Café, an all-day dining restaurant, serves both ala-carte menu and international buffets at breakfast, lunch and dinner. Set in a contemporary ambience, Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant exudes warmth and vibrance for your dining pleasure and business entertainment. Enjoy the culinary artistry of innovative Cantonese cuisine that will delight your eyes and palate. Unwind and chill out with family, friends and business associates at Lobby Lounge, a perfect enclave offering a wide selection of drinks and snacks. Stay relaxed at Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium.
